page.title: 19COMMUNICATIONS AND AMENITIES
page.content: Gittisham village is just three miles from Honiton where there is still a railway station serving trains between Exeter and London (Waterloo), and many other facilities, but the transport to Honiton itself is difficult if you haven't got a car. There is a shopping bus which goes to Honiton on a Tuesday morning for Market day but for any daily bus services people have to walk down to the main road. In the village we have a Post Office, a bakery and general store, and a motor mechanic will travel in to service cars. A fish van calls on a Wednesday and a butcher on Friday; a newsagent ensures daily papers. A milkman calls three times a week and a local farmer can supply milk in between times. Logs for the fires and christmas trees are readily available. All in all our everyday needs are met.
